thread.title: Barack Obama kitesurfing with Richard Branson in the British Virgin Islands
thread.title_full: Barack Obama kitesurfing with Richard Branson in the British Virgin Islands | Daily Telegraph

author: Staff writers
title: Barack Obama kitesurfing with Richard Branson in the British Virgin Islands
text:
FORMER US president Barack Obama and his wife Michelle clearly aren’t missing the White House too much.
As Donald Trump comes to grips with the intimidating burdens of his new job, the Obamas have been holidaying with billionaire Virgin founder Richard Branson.
Mr Branson has published a blog post with pictures and video of the former president kitesurfing off one of his private islands in the British Virgin Islands. The look on Mr Obama’s face reminds you of a kid who’s just tried chocolate for the first time.
media_camera Former US President Barack Obama on his holiday to Moskito Island. Picture: AP media_camera Branson jokes around with Obama. Picture: Jack Brockway/Virgin.com via AP
Apparently Mr Obama, who is a native of Hawaii, had told Mr Branson his security detail banned him from surfing during his time in office.
“Just before he became president, he had been surfing on a dangerous break in Hawaii,” Mr Branson wrote in his blog post.
“When he came in from an exhilarating session, the new head of his security team turned to him and said, ‘This will be the last time you surf for eight years.’ For the next eight years he didn’t have the chance to surf, enjoy watersports or do many of the things he loved.”
Mr Branson said after spending a couple days learning to kitesurf, Mr Obama bested him in a water-sport challenge. He also said inviting the Obamas to his island was “a huge honour.”
Mr Obama spent his first days after leaving Washington holidaying in Palm Springs, California. So he’s having a nice time.
Obama, Branson go kitesurfing
